page.title: 01A SLICE OF RURAL DEVON 1985
page.content: The area lies South of the market town of Chagford within Dartmoor National Park;three hills (Week Down,Nattadon, and Meldon) dominate the scene spectacularly. The unfenced turf is cropped by sheep and moorland ponies but bracken is shoulder high in summer. There are no great houses here but several ancient hamlets. The fields,mainly pasture for sheep and cattle retain their ancient granite walls topped with thorny hedges. The land is steep, small farms shelter in the valleys from the harsh Dartmoor weather. Swift boulder-strewn streams water the area. The tortuous lanes, widened in Victorian times, are still too narrow for cars to pass except in special places.The area is rich in wildlife and flowers.
